channel.title: Unbiased debate and discussion on religion and its God(s)
channel.description:
I've been thinking this over for a few days now. Myself being a Catholic/Christian, I came here to have an open - [b]unbiased[/b] - discussion on the topic of: religion. By being unbiased, I mean to have an open opinion about whatever you are making a point on, and to be able to back that point up using fact. Can you prove God/Jesus/religion is real? Can you prove God/Jesus/religion is fake? I want to hear what you guys have to say about those two questions. Can you even answer them? If so, let's hear it. Otherwise, [b]I don't want to see any crap related to biased remarks on how religion is complete fiction or on how religion is 100% real.[/b] That is only, of course, if you cannot back up your claim with decent proof or fact. Here's my side of the story: Take a look at the [i]Ten Commandments.[/i] They were supposedly written by God and given to Moses. But, after thinking about the Ten Commandments for quite some time, I came to a conclusion or two. [quote="Wikipedia(Passage_From_Bible)"]17 You shall not covet your neighbour’s house; you shall not covet your neighbour’s wife, or male or female slave, or ox, or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbour.[/quote] What is this? [i]You shall not covet your neighbour's [u]male or female slave.[/i] According to an [url=http://dictionary.com]Online Dictionary[/url], to covet means to have a wrongful desire for. So if I'm interpreting this correctly, then [b]God is telling us to not desire our neighbour's slave(s)?[/b] Wait a minute... doesn't God/Jesus/etc frown upon slavery? Doesn't He discourage it? Wasn't He the one who said all man was created equal? Because if I'm correct, then God is saying that to have a slave would not be against Him or His laws. Apparently He is telling us it is OKAY as long as we don't have a wrongful desire for our neighbour's slave. Odd, isn't it? Next up, if God is our... well, God, then wouldn't that mean we are His slaves? Doesn't that mean we must listen to him one hundred percent of the time, and that we must obey His every command? If so, then why is He contradicting himself? Last time I checked, He believed in free will. According to some interpretations of the Ten Commandments, one of those laws tell us NOT to swear. But according to our society and our way of life, these "swear words" were thought of/created AFTER these commandments were written. If you would think about that for just a minute, you would realize it doesn't make any sense. How can God create a law telling us not to swear before we even create these swears he talks about?
3 Do not have any other gods before me.
Wait a second. [i]Do not have any other gods before me.[/i] Doesn't this mean that there ARE infact other gods out there? If so, does that not mean that the Christian God is not the only 'heavenly father' out there, and that He did not create the Earth/Galaxy/Life Himself? [b]If God created us, and told us to behave nicely and to not murder, steal, disrespect our family, and disrespect our friends, why did he gave us the emotions and ability to do so?[/b] If he truely wanted to do so in the first place, couldn't he just get rid of our ability to do those things rather than to tell us to? It'd make more sense to me, to be honest. Why are there so many religions out in the world if according to God, we already know who created us and who is in charge? Shouldn't we all be bowing down to the one and only God, [b]rather than continuously inventing new religions and new Gods/beliefs to believe in?[/b] If you think about this, you could come to a quick and easy conclusion that religion was a simple, let's say [i]"invention"[/i], created by somebody earlier in time as a way to distract us. Not in a bad way, but the intention must have been to bring peace and balance to the world. By creating religion and so on, there would be a strong chance people would believe in [i]"the greater good"[/i] on a daily basis, creating a nice, happy world. Now that I'm done, I want to hear what you guys have to say. Remember, no garbage. Keep it clean, and let's hear YOUR side of the story.

item.title: Unbiased debate and discussion on religion and its God(s)
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I’ve been thinking this over for a few days now. Myself being a Catholic/Christian, I came here to have an open - unbiased - discussion on the topic of: religion. By being unbiased, I mean to have an open opinion about whatever you are making a point on, and to be able to back that point up using fact.

Can you prove God/Jesus/religion is real?
Can you prove God/Jesus/religion is fake?

I want to hear what you guys have to say about those two questions. Can you even answer them? If so, let’s hear it. Otherwise, I don’t want to see any crap related to biased remarks on how religion is complete fiction or on how religion is 100% real. That is only, of course, if you cannot back up your claim with decent proof or fact.

Here’s my side of the story:

Take a look at the Ten Commandments. They were supposedly written by God and given to Moses. But, after thinking about the Ten Commandments for quite some time, I came to a conclusion or two.

Wikipedia(Passage_From_Bible):

17 You shall not covet your neighbour’s house; you shall not covet your neighbour’s wife, or male or female slave, or ox, or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbour.

What is this? You shall not covet your neighbour’s [u]male or female slave. According to an Online Dictionary, to covet means to have a wrongful desire for. So if I’m interpreting this correctly, then God is telling us to not desire our neighbour’s slave(s)? Wait a minute… doesn’t God/Jesus/etc frown upon slavery? Doesn’t He discourage it? Wasn’t He the one who said all man was created equal? Because if I’m correct, then God is saying that to have a slave would not be against Him or His laws. Apparently He is telling us it is OKAY as long as we don’t have a wrongful desire for our neighbour’s slave. Odd, isn’t it?

Next up, if God is our… well, God, then wouldn’t that mean we are His slaves? Doesn’t that mean we must listen to him one hundred percent of the time, and that we must obey His every command? If so, then why is He contradicting himself? Last time I checked, He believed in free will.

According to some interpretations of the Ten Commandments, one of those laws tell us NOT to swear. But according to our society and our way of life, these “swear words” were thought of/created AFTER these commandments were written. If you would think about that for just a minute, you would realize it doesn’t make any sense. How can God create a law telling us not to swear before we even create these swears he talks about?

3 Do not have any other gods before me.
Wait a second. [i]Do not have any other gods before me.[/i] Doesn't this mean that there ARE infact other gods out there? If so, does that not mean that the Christian God is not the only 'heavenly father' out there, and that He did not create the Earth/Galaxy/Life Himself?

If God created us, and told us to behave nicely and to not murder, steal, disrespect our family, and disrespect our friends, why did he gave us the emotions and ability to do so? If he truely wanted to do so in the first place, couldn’t he just get rid of our ability to do those things rather than to tell us to? It’d make more sense to me, to be honest.

Why are there so many religions out in the world if according to God, we already know who created us and who is in charge? Shouldn’t we all be bowing down to the one and only God, rather than continuously inventing new religions and new Gods/beliefs to believe in? If you think about this, you could come to a quick and easy conclusion that religion was a simple, let’s say “invention”, created by somebody earlier in time as a way to distract us. Not in a bad way, but the intention must have been to bring peace and balance to the world. By creating religion and so on, there would be a strong chance people would believe in “the greater good” on a daily basis, creating a nice, happy world.

Now that I’m done, I want to hear what you guys have to say. Remember, no garbage. Keep it clean, and let’s hear YOUR side of the story.
